perturbation.original_text: 19. ARBITRATION: All disputes in connection with this Contract or the execution thereof shall be settled friendly through negotiations. In case no settlement can be reached, the case may then be submitted for arbitration to the Foreign Economic and Trade Arbitration Committee of the China Beijing Council for the Promotion of International Trade in accordance with its Provisional Rules of Procedures by the said Arbitration Committee. The Arbitration shall take place in Beijing and the decision of the Arbitration Committee shall be final and binding upon both parties; neither party shall seek recourse to a law court nor other authorities to appeal for revision of the decision. Arbitration fee shall be borne by the losing party.
perturbation.changed_text:
20. This final price is the confidential information. Dissemination, distribution or duplication of this price is strictly prohibited.

19. ARBITRATION: All disputes in connection with this Contract or the execution thereof shall be settled friendly through negotiations. In case no settlement can be reached, the case will be subject to non-binding mediation. In cases where both parties fail to come to an agreement during mediation, the parties may seek resolution in a court of law. The Arbitration shall take place in Beijing and the decision of the Arbitration Committee shall be non-binding upon both parties; either party shall seek recourse to a law court or other authorities to appeal for revision of the decision. Arbitration fee shall be borne by the losing party.
perturbation.explanation: The original arbitration clause mandated binding arbitration in Beijing. The modification weakens this by introducing non-binding mediation as a first step, allowing either party to then seek resolution in a court of law, and the original Arbitration Committee shall be non-binding, which goes directly against the original text which states the binding nature of the decision of the arbitration committee. This makes the arbitration clause much less enforceable and contradicts the intent of a clear, binding arbitration agreement. This makes it difficult to enforce since it gives the impression of a binding arbitration, but it is not.

perturbation.original_text: 18. LATE DELIVERY AND PENALTY: Should the Sellers fail to make delivery on time as stipulated in the Contract, with exception of Force Majeure causes specified in Clause 17 of this Contract, the Buyers shall agree to postpone the delivery on condition that the Sellers agree to pay a penalty which shall be deducted by the paying bank from the payment. The penalty, however, shall not exceed 5% of the total value of the goods involved in the late delivery. The rate of penalty is charged at 0.5% for every seven days, odd days less than seven days should be counted as seven days. In case the Sellers fail to make delivery ten weeks later than the time of shipment stipulated in the Contract, the Buyers have the right to cancel the contract and the Sellers, in spite of the cancellation, shall still pay the aforesaid penalty to the Buyers without delay, the seller should refund the money received and pay the 30% of the total goods price of the penalty

5. PACKING: To be packed in new strong wooden case(s) /carton(s), suitable for long distance transportation and for the change of climate, well protected against rough handling, moisture, rain, corrosion, shocks, rust, and freezing. The seller shall be liable for any damage and loss of the commodity, expenses incurred on account of improper packing, and any damage attributable to inadequate or improper protective measures taken by the seller in regard to the packing. One full set of technical All wooden material of shipping package must be treated as the requirements of Entry–Exit Inspection and Quarantine Bureau of China, by the agent whom is certified by the government where the goods is exported. And the goods must be marked with the IPPC stamps, which are certified by the government agent of Botanical–Inspection and Quarantine Bureau.

18. LATE DELIVERY AND PENALTY: Should the Sellers fail to make delivery on time as stipulated in the Contract, with exception of Force Majeure causes specified in Clause 17 of this Contract, the Buyers shall agree to postpone the delivery on condition that the Sellers agree to pay a penalty which shall be deducted by the paying bank from the payment. The penalty, however, shall not exceed 5% of the total value of the goods involved in the late delivery. The rate of penalty is charged at 0.5% for every seven days, odd days less than seven days should be counted as seven days. In case the Sellers fail to make delivery ten weeks later than the time of shipment stipulated in the Contract, the Buyers have the right to cancel the contract and the Sellers, in spite of the cancellation, are not required to still pay the aforesaid penalty to the Buyers without delay, the seller should refund the money received and not required to pay the 30% of the total goods price of the penalty
perturbation.explanation: Original text stipulates that even if the contract is canceled due to late delivery (beyond ten weeks), the seller must still pay the penalty and refund the money received. I have changed the text to say that with the seller canceling the contract, they are not required to pay a penalty or 30% of the total goods price. This makes the penalties for missing the delivery date unenforceable, which makes it difficult to enforce.
